page.title: 08Wave Reflection Wall 3.
page.content: If the wall had been straight the water would have eventually eroded it with continual battering. The wall is designed to prevent approximately 70% of the flooding experienced in 1977. In order to stop flooding completely the wall would have had to have been a lot higher than it is. This was not possible as it would have led to the spectacular views across the bay being lost. Some people argue that this has happened. When the new wall was first suggested press reports quoted residents calling the wall a 'concrete monstrosity'. But according to press reports after the 1983 floods, residents who were continually suffering through the floods welcomed the wall. The wall proved to be effective when put to the test in 1983.
